definition: to suddenly reveal/to flash (one's ID, a banknote etc)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: A group of people were expressing their support for the Palestinian people.
sentences.chinese: 一羣示威者亮出了支持巴勒斯坦的旗號。

sentences.english: Jack flashes his badge and tells her he’s after a suspect.
sentences.chinese: 傑克亮出了他的證件，稱自己是在追擊嫌犯。

sentences.english: Players shine to live absolutely severally in succession.
sentences.chinese: 選手們紛紛亮出各自絕活兒。

sentences.english: Don't reveal your trump card before the crucial moment.
sentences.chinese: 不到緊急關頭不要亮出撒手鐗。

sentences.english: Later, Wang Lixiao a way to think of knitwear manufacturer's identity.
sentences.chinese: 後來，王立曉想了一個辦法來亮出毛衫製造商的身份。

definition: to brandish (a figurative weapon, i.e. some measure intended to deal with the situation)/to resort to (some tactic)
cards in one's hand/(fig.) undisclosed strength or information/hidden trump
to take out/to put out/to provide/to put forward (a proposal)/to come up with (evidence)
to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold
to make a move (in martial arts or figuratively)
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
to wait for action after having accumulated power, energy etc
to assume/to adopt (a look, pose, manner etc)/to bring out for display
